title: Technical Lead: Control Plane
description:
At Prisma we are building the data layer for modern applications. If you are fascinated by the software that power large technology companies such as Twitter, Airbnb and Facebook but want the challenges and freedom that come with working in a small startup, then a job at Prisma might be for you.
With funding from top-tier Silicon Valley investors Amplify Partners and Kleiner Perkins we are a small distributed team working on making advanced data infrastructure developed at large tech companies accessible to all developers around the world.
We are focused on bottom-up adoption, and most of our software is open-source. We have a vibrant community on Slack and Github - with 40,000+ members on Slack - where we regularly engage with the Prisma community.
What would a Tech Lead (Control Plane) at Prisma do?
Until now, Prisma has been fully focused on developer adoption for our Open Source products. We have experience consistent growth in this arena and are no track to become the dominant NodeJS framework in 12 months. Considering this, we are ready to start building out our first enterprise product. This is a pertinent and central part of Prisma's vision and strategy for the future.
In order to achieve this goal, we are looking for a Tech Lead to help us build this product for enterprise customers. As Tech Lead you will form a new team and adopt two developers from the existing Prisma Engineering Team and work closely with the CEO, VP of Product and a Sales Engineer to spec and build this product.
Over time, this role has the capacity to expand into the overall ownership of all technical matters related to enterprise products at Prisma, forming a key strategic position within the company.
What are the requirements?
We believe that the right person would have the following:

Exceptional programming and technical expertise. Our language is Rust but learning on the job is totally fine if you are not currently familiar with Rust.
Extensive experience building and operating robust high-scale servers and the challenges around deploying to enterprises.
Strong software design and implementation skills in building infrastructure-frameworks.
Expertise in building distributed systems.
Experience building and operating extensible, scalable, resilient systems.
Solid understanding of Container Orchestration framework (such as Kubernetes).
Familiarity with Cloud Infrastructure Providers such as AWS, GCP, and Azure. Bonus points for experience with SaaS deployment strategies such as AWS PrivateLink.
Solid understanding of basic systems operations (disk, network, operating systems etc. )
Excellent leadership and communication skills.

The following would also be super helpful:

Experience working within Site Reliability Engineering would be be a big plus.

What's it like to work at Prisma?
You are likely to be a great for the team if you:
...have an ownership mindset. As part of a small team, you'll have an outsize impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
...stay nimble. As a growing startup, the team and strategy evolves quickly. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
...be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.
Remote Work
We are a remote first organisation with an office based in Berlin, Germany. Whether you work remotely, or from the office in Berlin is entirely up to you! We offer generous relocation assistance if you prefer the latter.
What's in it for you?

The opportunity to take the lead on key strategic objectives of Prisma and to exercise outsize impact on the overall direction of the organisation.
Competitive compensation including a commensurate Stock Option Package.
401K, or similar retirement funding for non-US residents.
Medical Cover, including Dental and Vision (or equivalent for non-US residents).
A generous tech-budget to get you all the latest hardware and software that you need.
Twenty-four days paid time off.
Herman-Miller ergonomic chair to spruce up your home office.

What is the process like?
Our recruitment process roughly follows the structure below:

Introductory call with our People Operations person.
First interview with the CEO or VP Product.
Second Interview with a key stakeholder from the Board of Directors or one of our VCs.
Interactive assignment where you will engage with the team via Slack to solve some problems in a collaborative way (we also provide a small stipend for the time and effort).
Team fit interview - if required.
Final Interview with the CEO.
Offer

What do I do now?
If this sounds like an interesting opportunity, please apply via our website, and include your LinkedIn profile (or Resume), Github Repo, or anything else that you think might give us a good sense of who you are.
We will generally be in touch within 7 business days to let you know the outcome of your application.
Prisma is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

location: remote - must be located in US
title: Experienced Power Apps developer
description:
Spear Technologies is an exciting new software company in the Insurance sector. Spear is looking for an experienced Power Apps developer to work on its core product.
www.spear-tech.com
Skills needed

2 - 4+ years of experience building Enterprise-level solutions utilizing best practices within Model-Driven Power Apps
Solid understanding of the Power Platform components, including Power BI, Power Automate, Portals AI Builder and Virtual Agents
Experience developing PCF controls for Power Apps
Strong programming skills in C# and Javascript
Experience with PowerApps integration with Azure API Apps, Azure Logic apps, Azure Functions and REST services
Experience developing solutions that span multiple Office365 services (e.g., SharePoint, Outlook, Graph API, One Note, One Drive, etc.)
Experience working with the Agile methodology and self-starter who can thrive in a dynamic environment
Strong interpersonal and communications skills and ability to multi-task effectively between projects

Degrees and Certifications


B.S. in Computer Science, engineering, or related technical discipline (Extensive, directly applicable experience may substitute for the academic degree requirement)


Training and/or certification for PowerApps Professional or PowerApps Developer


Training and/or certification for Microsoft Flow/Power Automate


Optional / Nice to have skills

Experience using XRM Tools
JavaScript experience with XRM WebAPI
Experience working with Business Central
Knowledge of insurance claims
Datalakes / data warehousing
Paginated reports with PowerBI
Document Management experience in PowerApps
Azure Storage (Blobs)
PowerApps security configuration

Benefits

Competitive salary contingent on experience
Heathcare, Dental, Vision
Great PTO
Work remotely – no commute
how_to_apply: Email your resume to Kate Taylor at ktaylor@spear-tech.com

title: Fullstack Mobile Engineer (React Native)
description:
Fullstack is looking for an experienced, passionate, and motivated React Native engineer who will help develop world class applications and products. Our native mobile products interact deeply with RESTful API backends, so knowledge of web application architectures and technologies is a plus. You will have the opportunity to work alongside a close knit group of very talented designers, engineers, and product managers to build software that makes a difference.
Primary Responsibilities

Drive development of our mobile applications, from architecture, to coding, to release.
Take ownership in developing and improving all aspects of our stack (development, testing, CI, automation, and architecture)
Release to both iOS and Android (Apple App Store, Google Play Store)
Designing and engineering features that deliver value to the people who use them.
Collaborating closely with the entire team (designers, product managers, etc.)

About FullStack
Our mission is to make our clients incredibly successful by developing and improving ideas into highly functional and usable web applications. Our team has become renowned in our ability to bring creativity, expertise, and sound development practices to notable and ambitious startups. Our development work focuses on architecting and building new applications as well as scaling existing apps for our clients as they grow.
Let’s Have A Chat If You…

Have developed React Native apps that communicate with Restful APIs, use local storage, network data synchronization, and user authentication.
Have a working knowledge of the Expo platform for React Native.
Understand and have experience making decisions about mobile application architecture, including data modeling, networking and data synchronization, and concurrency.
Are competent with developing application interfaces for multiple device types based off of mockups.
Strive to automate everything you do - from sending out builds to running tests.
Are equally comfortable working with HTTP-based web services, and have a working knowledge of web application and API architectures.
Are self-directed and able to manage your time effectively

Bonus points for…

iOS or Android development experience using Objective-C, Swift, or Android
Ruby on Rails development experience.
Knowing your way around XCode or Android Studio
Experience working with an agile / scrum-based development model
A BS or MS in Computer Science or, Math or another analytic disciplin
Previous history of working with a remote, distributed team

Other information about this position

Working remotely is how we operate
This is a per-project, contract position, with up to 40 hours per week '
The minimal contract length is 4 months, but could be longer
We are looking for people located within the 4 US time zones.

To Apply
Please email a copy of your resume to jobs@gofullstack.com.

title: Frontend Engineer (f/m/x)
description:
MILES glaubt an eine Welt, in der Mobilität geteilt, nachhaltig und für jedermann zugänglich sein sollte. An der Verwirklichung dieser Vision arbeiten wir Tag für Tag und setzen mit unserem Sharing-Angebot in den Städten dem privaten Autobesitz etwas entgegen. Wir wollen ein Teil des persönlichen Mobilitäts-Mixes der Menschen sein und somit das urbane Leben verbessern.
Join the ride!
We are looking for a React Native Engineer, who you will live on the front lines of the products we create.
We are looking for you to join our team as
Frontend Engineer (f/m/x)
Deine Aufgaben
Your mission

Building application across iOS and Android mobile platforms
Focus on native APIs for better integrations across those platforms
Maintain performance of the application
Maintain code and extend automated tests to ensure high product quality
Stay up to date with latest Apple and Google features

Was du mitbringst
Your profile

3+ years of experience of mobile development using React Native
Working comfortably with third-party dependencies e.g. Firebase
Good experience & understanding in Javascript, React/Redux and Redux Saga
Knowledge Native build tools like Xcode, Android Studio
Keen interest in UI/UX
Good understanding of the mobile architecture
Hands-on mentality and always strive to find the best solution
Experience  in Mobility Industry is a Plus
Professional English skills, German knowledge is nice to have

Warum MILES?

Be part of a high growth company with an established business model
With us you will have a "High Impact": We always listen to you and give you the necessary space to bring in and implement your creative ideas
Flat hierarchies? Then you are exactly right with us! You can also learn from our smart colleagues and develop your professional skills
MILES mood = feel good;) Cool and modern office with the latest equipment, joint team lunches and events, drink flatrate, muesli and for the daily ration of sugar, of course also something sweet
"Only public transport" was yesterday. With us you get a monthly contingent of MILES Credits for free rides
Carsharing with an extra ♥! At MILES we invest a part in regional and social projects, because we are actively involved in the well-being of our society and environment #milescharity

title: Senior Back End Developer
description:
Hiring exceptional back-end talent is mission-critical for TAUR. You will design, build and manage TAUR’s fundamental software infrastructure, including servers, databases and APIs. You’ll help keep our data secure and compliant with regulations. And you’ll help manage contractors.
Being a hardware company, any experience you have with IoT is a massive bonus point, as the systems you manage will interface regularly with our embedded systems/apps. You will need to have a broad understanding of the product firmware at least, if not understanding of the code itself.
In addition, you’ll be heavily involved in the development and deployment of our mobile apps (Android and iOS) and any web services that underpin our marketing/support teams. Of course your back-end experience will be invaluable here but any front-end ability is clearly an asset too.
In order of importance we’re looking for:

6+ years back-end software expertise: servers, databases and APIs.
Ability to develop scalable systems that add significant value to
TAUR.
Experienced software developer, highly knowledgeable about
advantages/drawbacks of different software stacks
Experience or strong interest in embedded programming and IoT
Proficient in managing code repositories, version control systems,
working in teams
iOS and Android app development experience
Web development experience
Knowledge of data warehousing, reporting, dashboards, analytics
Experience hiring and managing contractors and/or direct reports

To succeed in this role you’ll need to be:

Willing to contribute to a great work culture
Highly proactive
A true self-starter
An excellent communicator and team-worker
Able to break down business requirements and discuss – at a strategic high level as well as zoomed-in on low level detail
Appreciation of great design and UX
Hardworking and ambitious
Passionate about TAUR's goals and genuinely user-obsessed

Package: highly competitive
Reporting to: CEO
Location: London strongly preferred
––––––
About TAUR
Consumers are looking for transportation that’s quick, effortless and clean – especially from brands that care. Since early 2019, TAUR has been working to produce a truly roadworthy electric scooter, and not just one that’s great to ride but for the entire lifestyle that goes with owning one. Our recent Kickstarter campaign ($335k) was backed by hundreds of people – with thousands more desperate for a test ride next year.
Our exceptional team are from brands like Tesla, Apple, Uniwheel, Ford and British Airways, and we’re working full-throttle to deliver on our goals. We’re looking for more exceptional, multi-talented people who want a real challenge. We’ve just closed a highly successful seed round, and we’re aiming for a Series A in 2021. If this sounds like fun let's talk :)

title: Release coördinator
description:
Hoe sneller we IT-changes kunnen releasen, hoe sneller we kunnen inspelen op veranderende behoeftes van klanten, medewerkers en de maatschappij. Als release coördinator bij de Volksbank in Den Bosch ga jij voorop in de transitie naar agile releasen.
Samen met je collega-releasemanager leid jij de livegang van softwareproducten van maar liefst 25 ontwikkelteams in goede banen. De day-to-day-business zeg maar. Daarnaast ligt jouw focus vooral op het realiseren van structurele technische verbeteringen in het releaseproces. In de huidige opzet kennen wij weekreleases en jaarlijks 8 grote ketenreleases. Dit willen wij opknippen in kleinere componenten die sneller en vaker gereleased kunnen worden. Onze agile-teams willen wij dagelijks autonoom laten releasen zodat wij als bank supersnel kunnen inspelen op nieuwe behoeftes en maatschappelijke ontwikkelingen.
De Volksbank is een groot bedrijf met een complex IT-landschap. Een bank die openstaat voor verandering en veel potentie heeft, maar waarbij ook zeker uitdagingen te overwinnen zijn. In jouw rol ben jij de haarlemmerolie die de stakeholders verbindt en zorgt dat releaseprocessen succesvol worden afgerond.
Hier kom je te werken
Samen met je collega-releasemanager vorm je een gouden duo. Jij snapt releaseprocessen door en door en bent in staat het proces te begeleiden, terwijl je collega juist de ervaring met het succesvol begeleiden van releasetransities meebrengt. Met z’n tweeën richten jullie je dedicated op het releaseproces. Daaromheen krijgen jullie hulp van een regelmatig wisselende gelegenheidscoalitie met collega’s die de taken voor een aantal deelonderwerpen op zich nemen. Met dit releaseteam bouw je aan een wendbare IT-organisatie voor een nog mooiere bank.
Jouw kwaliteiten
Met jouw enthousiasme en gedrevenheid draag je eraan bij om van de Volksbank een nóg mooiere bank te maken. Jouw planmatige skills en resultaatgerichtheid zorgen ervoor dat releases succesvol worden afgerond. Van complexe vraagstukken krijg je energie en zowel hands on als op tactisch niveau voel jij jezelf uitstekend op je plek.
Verder heb je:

Minimaal hbo-niveau.
Bij voorkeur een diepgaande kennis van en ervaring met technische (on) mogelijkheden van de systemen en context van de Volksbank
Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met bestaande releaseprocessen van de Volksbank of een vergelijkbare organisatie.
Kennis en affiniteit met technieken die de transitie naar een beheerste agile releaseproces mogelijk maken.

Solliciteren?
Klik hier en reageer op deze vacature. Laat je motivatie en CV achter en we nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op. Voor vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact opnemen met Nikki Gunnink, E: nikki.gunnink@devolksbank.nl.
how_to_apply: Klik hier om te solliciteren op deze vacature!

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
Here at Playco, we make games that bring the world closer together through play.
As a Full Stack Engineer at Playco, you will play a pivotal role in creating a platform to revolutionize the instant games development industry. Our engineers are generally amazing at something and great at everything else. We write scalable backend systems, cross-compilers, JavaScript / TypeScript game APIs and tools, and whatever else it takes. No matter what you work on each day, you will work with the best engineers in the world; we have top talent in every part of our stack.
The Role

Be responsible for designing, developing and deploying major game features.
Own game feature areas from end-­to­-end.
Be the champion for the user!
Insist on the highest standards and create functional and engaging features that will delight our users.
Be part of a tight game development team looking to iterate fast on a fun concept and then building it out.
Have real input on end-user product.
Be a key member of a high performing software engineering team.
Collaborate with design, engineering and production teams to devise optimal engineering solutions to game requirements.
Hands­ on architect and coder for sophisticated client/server systems for mobile gaming.
Innovate and iterate on process, systems and technology to deliver world­-class social games.
Be a leader; Identify and articulate technical and production risks and obstacles, as well as generate solutions!

Desired Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience.
3+ years of professional software engineering experience.
Experience writing clean, testable, high-quality code and designing highly scalable systems in production.
Capable of JavaScript + HTML5 to create custom, interactive, user experiences that are enjoyable on all HTML5 browsers.
Proficient at using script debuggers like Chrome Debugger.
Solid familiarity with deployment on cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
Strong Computer Science fundamentals in object­-oriented design, algorithms, and data structures.
Advanced software engineering skills, including the ability to write maintainable and robust code in a popular object oriented language.
Solid familiarity with analytics and A/B testing in mobile games.
Familiarity with git, svn or other VCS.
Self starter, analytical and creative.
Strong team player with a positive attitude.
Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively on shared projects with designers, artists, testers, product managers and other developers.

Bonus

Expert knowledge of NodeJS and ES6 / TypeScript.
DevOps experience -- setting up CI/CD environments, orchestrating deployments, creating monitoring dashboards, anything that makes the development process easier, more enjoyable and more accountable.
Experience in game development and shipped titles.

title: Senior EJB Developer (Remote)
description:
THRIVE WITH AGILOFT
Are you an experienced Sr. Java Developer who is successful, motivated, smart, energetic, and looking for a rewarding position in a growing, profitable, and dynamic company?
Agiloft is expanding our developer team, looking for Sr. Java Developers that thrive working with enterprises in multiple industries, with unique business challenges requiring sophisticated solution design.
WHY JOIN AGILOFT?


Agiloft was named the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant.


Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years.


The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row.


Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization.


Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies.


Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.


As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards overachievement.
Position Overview
We are seeking an experienced Enterprise JavaBeans Developer who will join our fast-growing engineering team, working on mission-critical applications. Your duties will include developing scalable Java applications while providing expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing.
This is a remote-only position. You must be comfortable with setting your own schedule and proactively collaborating in a globally dispersed team using a variety of communication channels. You should have no less than three years of professional experience in building enterprise-grade applications. You must be able to write clean, well-documented code and ensure your programs run properly. We also expect you to be passionate about building software and perform well working in a geographically distributed and diverse team.
Job Responsibilities

Design and develop high-volume, low-latency applications that enhance the Agiloft core platform
Create well designed, testable, efficient code
Participate in all phases of the development lifecycle
Assist in preparation and production of releases
Ensure designs meet specifications
Investigate alternatives and technologies and present them for architectural review, in order to support continuous improvement

Job Requirements

Experience with J2EE, Tomcat, JBoss, and relational databases such as MySQL, MSSQL, Oracle
Computer Science degree or equivalent
Experience working on a large project
At least three years of post-graduate experience
Deep understanding of OO programming principles and commitment to clean, efficient, well-documented code.
Professional experience with EJB

BENEFITS AND PERKS

Competitive salary ($30 USD hourly)
Referral bonuses
Flexible work schedules
Professional development and career growth opportunities
Awesome team members

To Apply
For immediate consideration, go to  https://www.agiloft.com/Sr.EJB
how_to_apply: For immediate consideration, go to  https://www.agiloft.com/Sr.EJB

Working knowledge of Java


Experience with

Struts 2, JSP
Popular JS frameworks like Vue, React, Angular
Relational databases such as MySQL, MSSQL, Oracle
Rest API implementation

BENEFITS AND PERKS

Competitive salary ($30 USD hourly)
Referral bonuses
Flexible work schedules
Professional development and career growth opportunities
Awesome team members

INTERESTED? APPLY NOW!

title: DevOps Engineer (Remote)
description:
THRIVE WITH AGILOFT

Agiloft is expanding our developer team, looking for DevOps engineers that thrive working with enterprises in multiple industries, with unique business challenges requiring sophisticated solution design.
WHY JOIN AGILOFT?


Agiloft was named the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant.


Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years.


The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row.


Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization.

Experience with continuous integration / either continuous delivery tools

Experience supporting MySQL/MSSQL databases

Experience working in distributed teams
Fluent in the English language

BENEFITS AND PERKS

Referral bonuses
Flexible work schedules
Professional development and career growth opportunities

title: Android Developer (w/m/d)
description:
YAZIO wurde 2013 gegründet und ist mit über 10 Millionen glücklichen Nutzern eine der weltweit erfolgreichsten Ernährungs-Apps. YAZIO hat eine Mission: durch eine bessere Ernährung möglichst vielen Menschen zu einem gesünderen Leben zu verhelfen! Mit Nutzern in über 150 Ländern sind wir bereits auf einem guten Weg, dies zu erreichen. Dabei leben wir als "Remote First"-Unternehmen eine moderne Arbeitsform, bei der unser Team über mehrere Länder und Städte verteilt zusammenarbeitet.
Erfahre hier mehr über unser Team, unseren Bewerbungsprozess und offene Stellen: www.yazio.com/de/jobs
Deine Mission

Du bist ein Teil unseres Entwickler-Teams für unsere native Android App, den Android Excellence 2018 Gewinner
Du arbeitest im Team an unserer 100% Kotlin Android App
Du schreibst "clean code" und setzt dich mit Architektur-Pattern auseinander
Du schreibst Tests und kümmerst dich darum, dass auf unserem CI-Server alle Lampen grün leuchten
Du setzt dich mit aktuellen Technologien auseinander (z.B. Coroutines, Flow, Room, etc.)
Du stehst in engen Austausch mit unserem Produkt-, Design- und Backend-Teams
Du bringst die YAZIO Android App für Millionen von Nutzern auf das nächste Level

Dein Profil

Ausgeprägte Mobile-Affinität
Mindestens 1-2 Jahre Erfahrungen in der Android Entwicklung
Tiefgreifendes Verständnis des Android SDKs
Beherrschung unseres grundlegenden Technologie-Stack (100% Kotlin, Dagger, Flow, Coroutines, Retrofit)
Clean Code und SOLID sind für dich keine Fremdwörter
Beherrschung grundlegender "architectural patterns" (MVVM, MVP, MVI)
Beherrschung aller Material Design 2 Komponenten im Schlaf
Ein Auge für ein tolles Android- und benutzerfreundliches UI
Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von Apps auf Basis von "webservices" (REST, JSON)
Erfahrung im Umgang mit CI-Buildservern und Lint
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbares ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss
Interesse an den Themen Ernährung und Fitness ist ein Plus

Warum wir?

Dich erwartet ein spannendes Projekt mit Millionen Nutzern in über 20 Sprachen und 150 Ländern
Wir haben ein lebendiges und hochqualifiziertes Team mit Startup-Spirit, viel Flexibilität und flachen Hierarchien
Als “Remote First” Unternehmen mit einer ausgeprägten Remote-Kultur hast du die Möglichkeit zu 100% remote zu arbeiten (solange du dich in CET +/- 2h befindest)
Falls gewünscht stellen wir dir einen Platz in einem Coworking Space oder Gemeinschaftsbüro deiner Wahl zur Verfügung
Wir statten dich mit aktueller Hardware (Laptop, Smartphone, externer Monitor, etc.) deiner Wahl aus
Bei YAZIO erhältst du eine attraktive Bezahlung und jede Menge Urlaubstage
Wir leben eine Kultur die durch Fokus und Effizienz geprägt ist: Überstunden gibt es bei uns nicht und wenn doch mal mehr gearbeitet wird, kannst du die Stunden zu einem anderen Zeitpunkt abbummeln
Bei uns erwarten dich außerdem ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Entwicklungschancen, direkter Kommunikation und flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Freue dich darüber hinaus auf tolle mehrtägige Team Events mehrmals pro Jahr und vieles mehr

Klingt nach dir?
Du hast Lust bekommen, YAZIO mit uns gemeinsam weiterzuentwickeln und Menschen weltweit zu helfen, ein gesünderes Leben zu führen?
Dann freuen wir uns über deine aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen! Bitte sende uns folgende Dokumente zu:

Deinen Lebenslauf
Beispiele deiner Arbeit (z.B. GitHub, GitLab, etc.)
Ein Anschreiben, in dem du erklärst, wer du bist und warum du bei YAZIO arbeiten möchtest
Wenn du möchtest, sende uns etwas zu, was uns ein bisschen über deine Interessen und Hobbies zeigt (z.B. deinen Twitter/Instagram Account oder deinen Blog/ deine Website)

title: Data Scientist / Data Engineer
description:
Company Description
Here at YouGov we have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to market research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.
Specific to this role you will be working in a cutting edge data science and R&D heavy skunkworks project within YouGov. If you like data, ML, AI and, working with brilliant colleagues, you will really enjoy yourself in this role.
Job Description
We're looking for a software / data engineer with a data analyst mindset to join our lovely team at YouGov Signal!
Scope of work:

Research, analyse and assess data
Design algorithms and aggregates
Work with the product owner, figure out how to turn raw data into required deliverables
Generate and research data product ideas
Build proof of concept solutions to validate the ideas
Work closely with the development team on production implementations

Qualifications
Experience:

At least 2 years in the field or in a similar field (If you have more experience we will pay accordingly as we are hiring for multiple roles)

Skills/requirements:

Software / data engineering skills
Well organised & methodical
Good communication in English: both written and verbally

Nice to know:

Python
Experience with AWS Big Data tools and services
Spark and Hive

Additional Information
Location: WFH, preferably Poland, but anywhere in Europe is fine (the candidate will be working with mostly Polish people, but they are all fluent in English).
Salary is very competitive.
Interested?
Click here for the application form!
how_to_apply: Click here for the application form!

title: Python Software Enginer
description:
Who are we?
We are a highly skilled Development team within a fast-growing start-up from Utrecht focusing on the e-commerce and online marketing sectors. Channable was founded 6 years ago and developed into a company with an international team of over 100 young professionals. While you can still benefit from the start-up vibe, working at Channable also means being part of a professional company.
What will your role be?
In this position you will be part of the product team, that works on our main web application. You will mainly be working on our Python3 backend, which powers our API and serves as the main entry point for our services. You will also be working on our API integrations, ads services, our export channels, new user-facing features, and our background jobs through which we process hundreds of millions of products per day. You will also be closely working together with our Infrastructure and DevOps teams, which are working on many other services that power Channable under the hood.
Your tasks will include the following:

Contributing to our Python components and support new API’s
Design, development and testing of new product features
Collaborate with and review PRs of other team members
Improve the reliability and robustness of our application
Work on scalability and performance improvements
Work together with the sales and support teams on requirements and issues
We are using the following technologies and tools:

Languages: Python, SQL
Libraries: Flask, SQLAlchemy, Click, requests, async, logging
Tools: Postgres, Redis, GCS, Alembic, mypy, pip, Sentry, Icepeak
If you want to read more about our development adventures, check out our tech blog: https://tech.channable.com/
You can also take a look at some of our open-source work at https://github.com/channable to get a feeling of how we work together and what our code looks like.
Who are we looking for?

At least 2 years experience developing applications in Python
Experience with web APIs and related technologies is required
Good understanding of HTTP, TLS/SSL and TCP/IP
Familiarity with SQL and relational databases, preferably Postgres
Good working knowledge of Linux, git and the command-line
Committed to high engineering standards

And then there are some things that are ‘nice to have’:

Experience in tuning and scaling a big application
Familiar with functional programming and its concepts
Having worked with distributed systems before
DevOps mentality

**Practical requirements
-EU citizenship or a work permit, preferably already living in the Netherlands

Available for at least 4 days a week, preferably full-time

What do we offer?

Challenging full-time function with space for personal initiative
An interesting job within a talented development team, with different levels of experience
Competitive salary
Career opportunities within Channable
Working for a fast growing company with a young and ambitious team
Awesome office in the city center of Utrecht (but temporarily from home) and (online) activities like hackatons and sports groups

Do you have any questions about this vacancy? Please contact Nathalie (nathalie@channable.com).
Remark: The recent developments of the COVID 19 virus have led to worldwide measures. Channable is prioritizing the safety of its employees, therefore we are all working from home. Lucky for you, we are skilled with video calling! This means you can still apply for a job at Channable, and we can have interviews through Google Hangouts or Zoom. The onboarding will also be online, and we will take care you'll have all the hardware you need :-)
how_to_apply: Wanna join us? Please send your job application through our jobs page https://jobs.channable.com/o/python-software-engineer-1

title: Senior Flutter Dev on a New Platform Team
description:
Job description
We are hiring a Senior Flutter Engineer on our Mobile Banking Platform team to help create a new suite of secure, well documented, and beautiful widgets for internal banking applications.  You’ll work on the next version of our Flutter component library, iterating on the existing components to match what has already been outlined by our experienced Design team.  You’ll develop internal solutions that help additional engineering teams to finalize more complex views and workflows.
The work you produce must be well documented because it will be consumed by external teams.  And you should be comfortable working closely with other experienced engineers and have a patient understanding of requirements bound to banking rules and regulations.
We are looking for someone who is kind, fair, flexible, and calm.  Especially in crisis situations.  Here are some real examples of the work you will be doing:

Following a scrum agile approach to keep dev tasks planned, groomed, and sized
Implementing a new design language from the ground up using Flutter best practices
Testing flutter components on multiple form factors and platforms from mobile to web
Collecting and documenting research that can be used to influence stakeholder’s opinions
Write unit, snapshot, and integration test and reporting the results in a consumer-friendly manner
Building custom plugins for integration with native SDKs
Dealing with nuances across mobile and web platforms
Evolving our reliable and robust component examples for designers and developers
Educating other developers about your work thru well-documented specifications and screen-captured videos
Upgrading to the latest versions of Flutter, testing what works and what doesn't, and potentially reverting back
Responding to security researcher’s reports of security vulnerabilities, from understanding risks and validating vulnerabilities to instituting fixes

This is just a snapshot of what occurs on a daily basis. We expect your experience to merge and enhance ours! You can expect to teach, motivate, and guide and expect this to be reciprocated.
Experience

Minimum 1 year of Flutter experience in a production environment
Minimum 4 years of software development experience

Salary will range (US $80-180K per year) depending on experience and locale.

Denotes a must-have

Skills

Ability to take ownership of work items and help cultivate new ones with a Product-first mindset*
Domain-driven design experience within distributed systems*
GraphQL & REST API concepts and implementation patterns
Cloud-native / managed services exposure
Experience with event-driven system architectures

Languages/frameworks/libraries

Flutter*
Dart*
CI/CD experience for mobile applications*

Tooling

CI/CD Pipelines*
Familiarity with Rest APIs*
Apple Store Connect
Google Play Console
Familiarity with GraphQL queries
Exposure to E2E testing tools

About you:
We are looking for an experienced candidate who’s ready for a senior role. A bachelor's or master’s degree is not enough. You must have a proven record of creating and releasing commercial iOS and Android applications for public and private use.
There is a lot to be responsible for and own. You will not know the answers to everything so it is critical that you have excellent verbal and written communication skills, and that you understand how these skills help you to stay resourceful and take initiative. That passion you have for learning new things has paid dividends in the past.
This is a remote job. Our team spans several timezones and knowing how to close loops without losing days in between is easier because your level of organization helps those around you stay close. So if you live on the West Coast you are happy to work early hours in order to build strong bonds with those in other regions. You are driven to work with people across the globe and are respectful and courteous to backgrounds and circumstances while promoting a healthy sense of urgency because after all, you love to ship top-flight products. And you understand that the best product of all is a well cultivated and positive culture amongst those you appreciate calling your Team.

title: IT Solution Architect (w/m/d) Softwarearchitektur & -entwicklung
description:
Willkommen bei der KfW! Wir sind eine international agierende Förderbank, die für die nachhaltige Entwicklung von Umwelt, Gesellschaft und Unternehmen steht. Als Impulsgeber wirken wir aktiv an den Themen mit, die die Welt von morgen prägen. Wir fördern Windparks, Infrastruktur-Projekte, Schulen und Krankenhäuser, denn sinnvolle und nachhaltige Projekte sind unser Auftrag. Und wir bauen auf die Menschen, die bei uns arbeiten! Was das heißt? Dass Sie bei uns ein offenes und vertrauensvolles Miteinander finden, in dem wir Vielfalt und Inklusion leben – denn nur dort, wo viele verschiedene Perspektiven zusammentreffen, entstehen richtungsweisende Ideen. Deshalb fördern wir Ihre Kompetenz, Ihre Ideen und Ihr Engagement für Projekte, die die Welt verbessern. Gehen Sie mit uns Ihren Weg in die Zukunft.Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams in Berlin und unterstützen Sie uns als
IT Solution Architect (w/m/d) Softwarearchitektur & -entwicklung
Wir bieten facettenreiche Aufgaben


Softwareentwicklung und Service Lifecycle-Aktivitäten: Als Experte/in übernehmen Sie verschiedene Prozessaktivitäten im Rahmen der Softwareentwicklung und des Service Lifecycle (z. B. im Umfeld Java/Java EE, JavaScript (Bsp: Vue) und SAP ABAP). Dazu übernehmen Sie sowohl Verantwortung für die Gestaltung, Optimierung und Durchsetzung übergreifender Aufgabengebiete (z. B. Programmiervorgaben definierter Technologien, Gestaltung von IT-Prozessen) als auch für die Entwicklungswerkzeuge.

Umsetzung & Überwachung von IT-Governance- / Strategievorgaben: Sie sorgen für die Umsetzung und Konkretisierung der Strategien und Vorgaben für SWEP und Service Lifecycle-Aktivitäten. Außerdem wirken Sie an der Weiterentwicklung, in Zusammenarbeit mit "IT Strategy und Management“, mit.

Richtlinienkompetenz und Fachlichen Beratung: Ihre Methoden-/Richtlinienkompetenz nutzen Sie in der Begleitung von Entwicklungsaktivitäten sowie der Überwachung der Einhaltung von Vorgaben. Abhängig von den Vorgaben für Entwicklungsprojekte legen Sie die dezentrale Adaption der Softwarearchitektur sowie einzusetzende Methoden und Werkzeuge fest.

Entwicklung und Pflege von Standards & Werkzeugen im Aufgabengebiet: Nach Evaluierung neue Tools und Methoden für die Leistungserbringung in der IT, stellen Sie diese bereit (inkl. nutzergerechte Kommunikation und Anwenderschulung). Zusätzlich übernehmen Sie den 3rd Level Support von zentralen Komponenten für die Anwendungsentwicklung und Infrastruktur.

Qualitätssicherung in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Domänenarchitekten: Sie bewerten Architekturen regelmäßig gemäß Architektur- und SRC-Konformität (Security, Risk, Compliance) sowie Betriebsstabilität und binden die verantworteten Architekturbereiche in den Gesamtarchitekturplan ein. Weiterhin stellen Sie die Integration fachlicher und SRC-Anforderungen in den jeweiligen Ausschnitten der KfW IT-Gesamtarchitektur sicher.

Das bringen Sie mit


Abgeschlossenes Studium (Diplom/Master) mit Fachrichtung Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Banking und Finance, Informatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation


Erste relevante Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung und/oder mit Softwarearchitekturen sowie Kenntnisse aus dem bankfachlichen Bereich

Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Anwendungen in mindestens einer der folgenden Technologien Java/Java EE, JavaScript, SAP ABAP

Praxiserfahrung mit Sourcecodeverwaltung auf Basis von GIT, bzw. SAP Solution Manager sowie im Umgang mit den Tools Virtual Forge CodeProfiler, SonarQube, SparxSystems Enterprise Architect, SAP Sybase Power Designer
Ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise und hohe Zielorientierung, die Sie beim Finden kreativer Lösungen gewinnbringend einsetzen, sowie starke konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, die Ihnen dabei helfen andere von Ihren Lösungen zu überzeugen

Ein Plus, kein Muss:

Programmierkenntnisse mit Cobol und C++
Sie haben bereits (Teil-)Projektleitungen übernommen und kommunizieren sicher auf Deutsch und Englisch


Damit fördern wir Sie – Benefits bei der KfWBetriebliche Altersversorgung


Vereinbarkeit von Familie & Beruf

Wir unterstützen Sie mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice Möglichkeiten, 30 Tagen Urlaub, individuelle Teilzeitmodellen und Eltern-Kind-Büros.



Marktgerechte Vergütung

Bei uns erwartet Sie ein angemessenes Vergütungspaket mit vermögenswirksamen Leistungen und Jobticket.



Gelebte Vielfalt & Inklusion

Vielfältigkeit und Chancengleichheit sind für uns als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt gelebter Alltag.



Weiterentwicklung & Trainings

Immer auf dem neusten Stand mit persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten.



Betriebliche Altersvorsorge

Wir bauen auf Ihre Zukunft mit einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge.



Gesundheitsförderung

Mit über 30 Betriebssportgruppen bis hin zu Gesundheitskursen und einem Mitarbeiterrestaurant unterstützt die KfW Ihre Gesundheit



Sie möchten Verantwortung übernehmen und gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft gestalten?
Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung als IT Solution Architect (w/m/d) Softwarearchitektur & -entwicklung über einen Klick auf den Bewerbungsformular. Bei Fragen zur Position können Sie sich gerne an Till Jünger wenden.
Klicken Sie hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!
how_to_apply: Klicken Sie hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Company background
We craft our own Blockchain solutions for established companies that want to solve major challenges of their industries.
This is an opportunity to be one of the first to join a startup created by three outstanding founders that have worked both for startups (raising more than $100m from top tier investors worldwide), for venture capital funds (managing over €100m in assets under management) and for large enterprises (leading technologic developments in a variety of fields).
We focus on delivering solutions highly relevant to actual business needs of our partners and that can be of use for entire industries.
We believe in having small teams of outstanding professionals, always with a focus on personal growth of each of them, and sharing the company's success with our team.
As a software engineer at Clariteia:

You will work directly with one of the cofounders and CTO, who previously lead Blockchain development for one of the largest European companies.
You will work in a core project for one major player in the music industry.
You will be able to work on a variety of functionalities and technologies:
Blockchain: distributed databases based on graphs, consensus algorithms and digital certificates.
Data science: fraud detection systems, search engines and predictive recommendations.

Role Specifics
Minimum qualifications:

Experience as a technical influencer for highly scalable distributed system designs.
Experience with coding in data structures, algorithms and software design.
Experience using cloud platforms and/or containerized application deployments.
Experience delivering complex, large scale and critical products with business impact.
Experience in Microservices Architecture.
Experience in working agile methodologies.
Write well designed, testable, efficient code.
Professional experience of cloud platform hosting via AWS / GCP as well via terraform / cloudformation / helm.
Experience with Python
gRCP
AsyncIO
CLI development
Flask/Falcon
Familiar with Kafka
Familiar with common CI/CD like Jenkins, Bamboo, Spinnaker.
Familiar with common monitoring / alerting / logging tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, ELK stack, distributed tracing.
Fraud Dection Algorithms

A Plus qualifications:

C
Rust
Blockchain
AI

title: Frontend Developer
description:
About the Job
Join us and be a part of a start-up cell of a large international company, where you will be working with state-of-the-art technology, make use of NLP and Machine Learning, and where your career can grow exponentially.
You will be part of the Paperpal team powered by CACTUS, where we are rethinking how science is communicated and helping scientists write better science smarter. You will be part of an international working environment, with employees across the EU and Asia, who work together to build cutting-edge web experiences and APIs used globally by scientists.
This is a remote working opportunity.
Responsibilities:
Your role will be to further develop and maintain a web-based product catering to scientific authors from all over the world, from the perspective of a frontend developer. This means:

Writing new functionality in an existing frontend framework, a modern tech stack with React, Node.js, Redux and Typescript
Build and release software through Jenkins, onto an AWS microservice architecture using Docker
Implement UX designs in a responsive frontend. You will not be required to create designs yourself from scratch, though, we may at times ask you to prototype things with your own designs.
Being part of a small team of about 3-4 people, participating in stand ups, and delivering code into this team
Being part of code reviews of your and other people's code
Keeping a critical B2B2C product running fast, stable, smooth and monitorable 24/7/365

So how do we know that’s you?

You have at minimum 6 years (including side projects, student jobs, etc. Does not include code written as part of a university degree) experience programming in JavaScript variant – Typescript preferred, and frontend frameworks such as React.
You have knowledge of best practices in frontend development (such as basic knowledge of accessibility).
You are motivated, curious and independent, with a desire to learn, and be a part of a growing company. You are motivated to learn from people with deep industry insights – but also willing to challenge and question decisions, and ask intelligent questions.
Experience with React.js and Typescript is preferred, but not required.

What’s in it for you?

Global exposure: You will work with a global team and will get in-depth experience.
Culture & Team: We never stop recruiting the best people because without an amazing team nothing is possible. People at Paperpal are awesome to work with, driven, smart and know how to get things done like nobody else.
Learn & Grow: Our goal is to keep you as long possible and help you build a career with us. We do this by creating an environment where you will grow both personally and professionally.
Satisfaction & Recognition: With some of the biggest names across the globe as existing clients, doors will open and conversations will flow. You will see the results of your efforts translate into maximum impact. With a competitive salary and our recognition programs, you will be rewarded for your success.

Awards and Recognition:

Among the Best Companies for Millennials 2019
Best Organization for Women’s Talent Development 2019N
Among the top 20 companies on FlexJob’s global list of the Top 100 Companies to Watch for Remote Jobs 2016-2020

About Paperpal
Powered by machine learning and trained on millions of published articles, Paperpal aims to simplify scientific writing. Founded by a small team across Denmark and India, Paperpal helps write, revise, and perfect academic text instantly. Paperpal uses cutting edge Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing in combination with the most knowledgeable people in the business, to accelerate scientific discovery. Paperpal aims to deliver the absolute best services and products, direct to the millions of scientific authors in the world who need to focus on science, and not details of presentation of their research.
About Cactus
Cactus Communications was founded in 2002 and aim to be the global organization that helps increase the speed and impact of research publishing worldwide. We partner with researchers, universities, publishers, academic societies, and life science organizations through innovative products and services developed under the brands Editage, Cactus Life Sciences, R,  Impact Science, UNSILO, and Cactus Labs.

title: Senior Backend Engineer / Backend Developer Azure (mobile Applikationen) (m/w/d)
description:
Was machen wir
Wir, die BEENIC GmbH, sind ein junges Corporate Venture des EWE-Konzerns und beschäftigen uns mit der emotionalen Visualisierung von Stromdaten aus privaten Haushalten, um dem Kunden hochwertige und personalisierte Services über eine App zur Verfügung zu stellen. Diese gehen weit über klassisch langweilige Energieanwendungen hinaus und bieten vielfältige Entwicklungsperspektiven. Dabei setzen wir auf eine stark nutzerzentrierte Produktentwicklung, welche den Alltag des Nutzers verbessern soll.
Wir haben eine offene Mentalität - neue Ideen, Kreativität und Anpacken gehören bei uns zum Selbstverständnis.
Was erwartet Dich

Du bist Teil eines wachsenden 15-köpfigen Innovationsteams, das nach agilen Prinzipien lebt und sich voll und ganz auf ein offenes Plattform-Ökosystem mit White-Label-Apps auf Basis von Energiedaten fokussiert
Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die (Weiter-)Entwicklung unseres cloudbasierten und mandantengetrennten Data- und App-Backends in MS Azure und gestaltest einen automatisierten Workflow mit
In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Plattform-Architekten entwickelst Du unterschiedliche technische Schnittstellen zu den Systemen unserer White-Label-Kunden, harmonisierst Datenformate und stellst einen reibungslosen Datenstrom in unsere App sicher
Du definierst Performance-KPIs, schreibst in Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Testmanager automatisierte Tests für Deinen Entwicklungsbereich und sicherst damit die Qualität Deiner Umsetzung ab
Du verstehst es, Anforderungen unterschiedlicher Features des Produktes parallel zu bedienen und bist es gewohnt in einem Team aus App-Entwicklern, Data Scientisten, Test Managern und Product Ownern zu arbeiten

Was Du unbedingt mitbringen musst

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation gepaart mit fundierter Erfahrung in der Konzeption und Umsetzung komplexer IT-Projekte (gerne auch in der Selbständigkeit)
Du hast eine proaktive und vorausschauende Arbeitsweise, erkennst potentielle Entwicklungsprobleme bereits vorab und es ist für Dich selbstverständlich, effiziente und nachhaltige Lösungen umzusetzen
Dein Arbeitsstil ist sehr genau, strukturiert und Du durchdringst komplexe Zusammenhänge zwischen Hardware, Plattformarchitektur, Softwareanforderungen und Cloud-Systemen
Dein eigenmotiviertes Ziel ist es, das Beste aus unserem Produkt herauszuholen. Du möchtest, ebenfalls wie wir, mit diesem Produkt Markführer werden.
Du hast Erfahrung mit hochverfügbaren Systemen und bist stolz darauf, wenn Deine Systeme seit Monaten ohne Ausfälle ihren Job tun.
Skalierung ist für Dich kein Fremdwort und Dir ist klar, dass ein System mit hundert Datenquellen anders designed sein muss als eines mit einer Million.

Was wir Dir bieten

Die Möglichkeit, den Aufbau einer agilen, neu gegründeten Gesellschaft im EWE-Konzern maßgeblich mitzugestalten
Abwechslungsreichen Aufgabenbereich in einem dynamischen Expertenteam
Hohen Grad an eigenverantwortlichem Arbeiten und große Umsetzungsfreiheit
Motiviertes Team mit dem klaren Mindset, Marktführer im eigenen Segment zu werden
Vertrauensarbeitszeit in Verbindung mit einer Zielvereinbarung und natürlich die Möglichkeit aus dem Home-Office zu arbeiten

Komm zu uns
Wenn Du Dich in der Beschreibung wiederfindest, bewirbst Du Dich hoffentlich bei uns. Nicht nur Kollegialität und Teamgeist sind uns extrem wichtig. Auch neue Vorschläge, sowie offenes und direktes Feedback, sind nicht nur erwünscht, sondern werden von Dir erwartet! Du sollst die Zukunft der BEENIC GmbH aktiv mitgestalten!
Die Integration von Menschen mit Behinderung entspricht unserem Selbstverständnis und wir begrüßen daher deren Bewerbung. Unsere Ausschreibung richtet sich an alle Geschlechter dieser Gesellschaft gleichermaßen.
Für alle Fragen steht Dir gerne Herr Fabian Zaps zur Verfügung. Schreib uns einfach.

title: App Developer Android (m/w/d)
description:
Was machen wir
Wir, die BEENIC GmbH, sind ein junges Corporate Venture des EWE-Konzerns und beschäftigen uns mit der emotionalen Visualisierung von Stromdaten aus privaten Haushalten, um dem Kunden hochwertige und personalisierte Services über eine App zur Verfügung zu stellen. Diese gehen weit über klassisch langweilige Energieanwendungen hinaus und bieten vielfältige Entwicklungsperspektiven. Dabei setzen wir auf eine stark nutzerzentrierte Produktentwicklung, welche den Alltag des Nutzers verbessern soll.
Wir haben eine offene Mentalität - neue Ideen, Kreativität und Anpacken gehören bei uns zum Selbstverständnis.
Was erwartet Dich

Du bist Teil eines wachsenden ca. 15-köpfigen Innovationsteams, das nach agilen Prinzipien lebt und sich voll und ganz auf ein offenes Plattform-Ökosystem mit White-Label-Apps auf Basis von Energiedaten fokussiert
Du konzipierst und entwickelst responsive und maximal nutzerzentrierte Android-Anwendungen auf Basis von neuesten Ansätzen der Softwareentwicklung
Für visionäre Mehrwertdienste übernimmst du die technische Ausgestaltung von Pilotprojekten bzw. Prototypen
Du stellst den modularisierten Aufbau der Grundarchitektur sicher, um individualisierte Kundenreleases flexibel und automatisiert voranzubringen
Die aktive Mitgestaltung für technologische Architektur und Weiterentwicklung der Anwendungen und Qualitätssicherung, werden von Dir und Entwicklerkollegen (w/m/d) stetig begleitet
Du brennst für unser Produkt und hast eine intrinsische Motivation das Beste aus diesem Produkt herauszuholen. Du möchtest, ebenfalls wie wir, ein Marktführer-Produkt entwickeln

Was Du unbedingt mitbringen musst

Neben Teamplayerqualitäten, hast du Interesse an technologischen Trends und Spaß daran komplexe Zusammenhänge zu durchdringen sowie lösungsorientiert daran zu arbeiten
Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Android Apps, Verständnis für App Architekturen und möchtest Codes stetig verbessern
Expertise im Testing (UI/Unit/Integration), Debugging und Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Continious Integration und Delivery/Deployment (CI/CD) zeichnen Dich aus
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik und Erfahrung mit der Programmierung komplexer mobiler Anwendungen (gerne auch in der Selbständigkeit)

Was wir Dir bieten

Die Möglichkeit, den Aufbau einer agilen, neu gegründeten Gesellschaft im EWE-Konzern maßgeblich mitzugestalten
Abwechslungsreichen Aufgabenbereich in einem dynamischen Expertenteam
Hohen Grad an eigenverantwortlichem Arbeiten und große Umsetzungsfreiheit
Motiviertes Team mit dem klaren Mindset, Marktführer im eigenen Segment zu werden
Vertrauensarbeitszeit in Verbindung mit einer Zielvereinbarung und natürlich die Möglichkeit aus dem Home-Office zu arbeiten

Komm zu uns
Wenn Du Dich in der Beschreibung wiederfindest, bewirbst Du Dich hoffentlich bei uns. Nicht nur Kollegialität und Teamgeist sind uns extrem wichtig. Auch neue Vorschläge, sowie offenes und direktes Feedback, sind nicht nur erwünscht, sondern werden von Dir erwartet! Du sollst die Zukunft der BEENIC GmbH aktiv mitgestalten!
Die Integration von Menschen mit Behinderung entspricht unserem Selbstverständnis und wir begrüßen daher deren Bewerbung. Unsere Ausschreibung richtet sich an alle Geschlechter dieser Gesellschaft gleichermaßen.
Für alle Fragen steht Dir gerne Herr Fabian Zaps zur Verfügung. Schreib uns einfach.

title: Junior Android Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Trade Republic is a European platform for mobile investing. With its intuitive app, people can save, invest, and trade on the capital markets commission-free with just three taps. Trade Republic's vision is for everyone to have the opportunity to take managing their investments into their own hands.
Trade Republic is a bank licensed in Germany and supervised by the Bundesbank and BaFin. Their cooperation with well-known partners such as HSBC, BlackRock, and solarisBank underlines the high quality and security of their service. Trade Republic's investors include Accel, Creandum, Founders Fund, and Project A, as well as sino AG.
What you'll be doing

Working with our existing Android team to help build and maintain new and existing features in the Trade Republic app
Being involved in our feature processes, working closely with the product and design team to help refine our new features
Work in a fast paced agile environment, where you will have the opportunity to take on responsibilities and ownership
Work closely with experienced team members to deliver great value to our customers

About You

You are comfortable with Kotlin and the Android Framework
You care about quality, and strive to achieve this both in code and for the product itself
You have an eye for detail and a passion for UI/UX
You enjoy working in an agile environment and have a self-driven personality with a “hands-on” approach
You are a well rounded software developer who understands the importance of communication
You are looking for an environment where you can have a large impact while continuing to develop and learn

Tech Stack

100% Kotlin
RxJava3
MVVM
Dependency Injection (Dagger2) and wide unit test coverage
Retrofit/OkHttp
WebSockets with a custom protocol, that bridges the reactive contract over the network
