title: Scrum Master IT
description:
Imagine…
That you work as a Scrum Master in a dynamic team where we value "fun", where customer and employee satisfaction are our priority and where people strive for maximum customer value. Imagine, you work in a department where people are redefining Business Lending for the digital era.
Making a difference
Rabobank serves 9 million clients globally and owns more than 40% of the corporate lending market in the Netherlands. The tribe Business Lending is one of the largest tribes within the bank and within our Loan Servicing Area we focus on improving our service processes with eight multidisciplinary squads. We use both Java and the the Pega Platform to digitize our service processes, automating administrative tasks for increased speed, flexibility and efficiency.
We believe that developing high performing teams starts with an experienced Scrum Master, who actively facilitates his or her team(s) to continuously stay focussed on the sprint goals and improvement potential to add value for our customers. To do this, you prepare and facilitate the Scrum rituals. You make sure that you choose the right incentive at the right moment to help the team.
You see opportunities everywhere to improve collaboration within and between different teams and with our customers. You know how to strike the right balance between coaching, mentoring, teaching and facilitating.
You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves.
Your Scrum Master toolset consists of:

Experience, you did already coach 2-3 DevOps teams in a distributed environment.
Supporting, you support the team in the scrum ceremonies and team building sessions.
Listening, focussing on what is being said instead of what you want to say.
Coaching, being empathic and helping people grow.
Change management, having the skills to help teams change their behaviour.
Organising, helping the teams understand and show their added value.
Conflict handing, by bringing issues on the table and constructively facilitating these matters.
Feedback, being able to point out the consequences of one’s behaviour on the team.
Communication, you know how to express yourself and to explain the way of working in- and outside the team.

With each other
Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together to build the best solutions for our clients.
With you
In the Lending Enterprise department, we value customer focus, a good energy level, motivation to get things done, empathy and embracing change. In addition, it's important that you recognise yourself in the checklist below:

A bachelor’s degree or higher.
Official Scrum Master certificate, scrum.org, PSM-I preferably PSM-II.
5+ years or more experience in IT software development as Scrum Master in a coaching/facilitating role.
Knowledge of and experience with Agile, SCRUM, LEAN, DevOps.
Knowledge of and experience with the combination of business domain and related IT chains.
Knowledge of and experience with tools like Azure DevOps.
Knowledge of Continuous Delivery principles.
Knowledge of and experience with ITIL and operational support processes is a plus.
Lots of humor

Interested?
Do you want to become the best version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development and to invest in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate, create and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-hour working week), you can also expect:

a gross monthly salary between 3.714,- and 5.304,- (scale 9);
a thirteenth month and holiday pay;
an Employee Benefit Budget of 10% of your gross salary. You decide how to spend this budget. - This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out;
100% reimbursement of the costs of home/work travel if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a home/work travel allowance;
a pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 3,5%.

Let's meet.
Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Scrum Master and to make a difference for yourself, for our customers and for society? Then do not hesitate and send your cv and motivation letter to us via the application form so we can invite you for a personal meeting.
Good to know:

Applications are open until this vacancy is filled. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy.
If you have any questions about the specific details of this position, please contact Lenneke Roescher, IT Lead, via lenneke.roescher@rabobank.nl.
Floris Rank, IT Recruiter, would be happy to answer questions about the application procedure via Floris.Rank@rabobank.nl.
The application process includes obligatory screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff matches the high standards we pursue to work at Rabobank.
The application process for this vacancy includes an individual assessment.
Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Senior Rails Developer
description:
Want to work remotely? Want to make an impact by working for a small company that values autonomy and working collaboratively in a team to solve challenging problems? Love learning new technology? Then you'll fit right into the Marketcircle Team!
We are looking to hire a talented Ruby on Rails Developer to maintain and extend our Daylite API to take the Daylite CRM platform to the next level. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the services uses by web and client apps, testing performance, troubleshooting, monitoring, and ensuring reliability.
To ensure success as a Ruby on Rails Developer, you should have extensive experience working with Ruby and back-end integration techniques. Ultimately, a top-level Ruby on Rails Developer can create clean, functional code that ensures a high degree of software quality.
Senior Rails Developer Responsibilities:
-Designing and developing new web applications.
-Maintaining and troubleshooting existing web applications.
-Writing and maintaining reliable Ruby code.
-Integrating data storage solutions.
-Creating back-end components.
-Identifying and fixing bottlenecks and bugs
-Integrating user-facing elements designed by the front-end team.
-Connecting applications with additional web servers, authentication, and payment backends.
-Maintaining APIs.
-On-call duties.
Senior Rails Developer Requirements:
-Have 5+ years of experience.
-Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field.
-Experience working with Ruby on Rails as well as libraries like Resque and RSpec.
-Experience with Docker and Kubernetes.
-Ability to write readable and maintainable Ruby code.
-Proficiency with code versioning tools including Git, Github, SVN, and Mercurial.
-Familiarity with MVC, Mocking, RESTful, ORM, and testing tools.
-Are comfortable working remotely (100% remote work environment, but located within Canada) as well as being comfortable working both independently and collaboratively.
Though this is a remote position, applicants must reside within Canada.
Marketcircle Inc. is a fun and distributed tech company. We believe in the power of Kaizen, teamwork, creativity, ownership, and empathy. By embodying these core values we know we impact the lives of our customers, and each other.
Our mission is to empower small business worldwide which drives us to develop a native macOS and iOS app that helps thousands create organization of what would otherwise be chaos.
Tired of a long commute to work? As long as you have reliable internet, and can work between 10:00AM - 3:00PM EST (core hours), you can work from anywhere! We expect results, not monkeys sitting in cubes for 10 hours a day! Though we are mostly remote, our team tries to meet up in the office every now and again to share some laughs, build camaraderie and eat some good food! We also make it a point to do activities together, like axe throwing, escape rooms, evenings out, etc.
Marketcircle provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 905-480-5555 and/or elynch@marketcircle.com.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Javascript, GraphQL & Positive Social Change)
description:
Kiron Open Higher Education is a non-profit organization offering free online learning opportunities to refugees and underserved communities worldwide since 2015. Through the platform, Kiron Campus, students receive access to high-quality higher education and a large online student community. Kiron’s innovative model consists of free, tailor-made study programs by clustering Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) from renowned educational providers and Open Educational Resources (OERs) for academic, professional and personal growth.
Kiron is looking for an experienced and highly motivated Software Engineer who wants to have a world-changing impact. We want you to join our team and work on building apps for the learning and growth of refugees and disadvantaged people. The small size of our organization and the huge size of the challenge in front of us means that you would be an integral part of creating the future of Kiron and of the product development team in general. The role is based in Berlin but we’re accepting applications from anywhere - especially as we expect to be mostly remote for a while. Don’t worry if you don’t have all of the skills or experience listed below, we want to see your application anyway!
Tasks

Join one of our product development teams and the Kiron Engineering Community and commit to working with a strong user-focus so that we can build products that help a wide range of refugee students
Help us improve Kiron Campus – a web application for online learning built with React + GraphQL
Work on improving our SaaS product, built out of Kiron Campus, that we’re offering to social businesses that want to provide an online learning experience for their own users, particularly relevant after the events of 2020!
Join us to implement a 1st-class offline and low-network learning experience through our apps, serving an atypical set of user devices and bandwidth problems - This is not your typical Berlin start-up challenge!
Collaborate with a wildly cross-functional team from engineering, product and design, instructional and educational design
Mentor and teach other engineers - while learning from them too
Take ownership and help set direction for the features and services you are building for the Kiron students.

Requirements

You share our vision of free and democratic access to education for refugees and disadvantaged communities worldwide
You possess strong experience working with Javascript (2+ years) and a strong familiarity with modern frontend JS frameworks such as React
You have experience working in an agile delivery team
You are fluent in English
You are ready and excited to have a big impact on Kiron and its’ students

Benefits

The chance to be part of a fun, dynamic, international, interdisciplinary, and highly committed team
The chance to shape a fast-growing social startup with your initiative and creative input
A (mostly) bleeding edge tech stack. We’re not dogmatic about technologies but here’s some keywords that indicate the type of technologies we’re using right now. Keywords: React, Flow, Typescript, GraphQL, PWA, TWA, Laravel, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes
Flexible working hours, 30 vacation days and a generous home office policy
A dog-friendly and spacious Berlin office with beautiful sunset views (We’re totally remote right now, but we hope to be back again as soon as it is safe, with appropriately flexible Working from Home policies from then on)

Ready to join our mission? Apply now! Include your cover letter, CV and possible starting date in English in a single PDF file by 27th December 2020 to Rohit Kakar.
Diversity is the core of Kiron. With employees from over 25 different nationalities, we embrace and celebrate the diverse background of our employers and the students we serve. We will consider all job applications without regard to gender expression, race, color, ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual/affectional orientation, age, physical character or disability.

title: Chapter-Lead DevOps (w/m/d)
description:
Über uns
talentsconnect ist ein HR-Tech Unternehmen aus Köln, das die Regeln der Karriereplanung verändert. Wir glauben daran, dass es für jeden Menschen den passenden Job gibt und wollen es Menschen ermöglichen durch Technologie ihre Karriereplanung selbst in die Hand zu nehmen, egal ob sie auf der Suche sind oder nicht.
Unsere Technologie wird inzwischen von vielen Unternehmen eingesetzt. Kunden wie Vodafone, Sixt, die Metro Group, Airbus, E.ON, Covestro und Viessmann verändern mit uns den Markt. Gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden gestalten wir die Bewerbung der Zukunft. Wir übersetzen für unsere Kunden die Learnings aus dem E-Commerce in das Recruiting und Employer Branding. Denn im E-Commerce dreht sich bereits alles um den Nutzer. Das adaptieren wir auf die Bewerber unserer Kunden und ermöglichen eine einfache und schnelle Bewerbung von überall. Wir sind stolz auf das was wir tun und arbeiten leidenschaftlich daran. Seit unserer Gründung 2013 ist unsere Team bereits auf über 60 Mitarbeiter gewachsen.
Deine Aufgaben
Als Chapter Lead für DevOps definierst Du die Struktur deines Teams bei talentsconnect von morgen.
Wir verstehen unter DevOps im Grunde alles, was mit Code passiert nach dem Push eines Entwicklers, CI/CD Pipeline, Prozesse inkl. QA (in Absprache mit dem Chapter-Lead QA) und Live-Betrieb inkl. Incident-Management.
Als Chapter-Lead für DevOps bist Du für die Weiterentwicklung deiner Member verantwortlich und definierst zusammen mit dem Squad-Lead eine langfristige DevOps Strategie.

Du bist verantwortlich für unseren Fachbereich (Chapter) DevOps insbesondere Personalverantwortung, aber keine Budgetverantwortung (liegt in der Squad)
Du wirst mittelfristig auch Mitglied einer Squad (cross-funktionales Team) sein und dort bei allen alltäglichen DevOps-Aufgaben unterstützen
Aufbau und Entwicklung des Chapter DevOps
Analyse, Dokumentation, Vereinheitlichung sowie Automatisierung unserer Tools und CI/CD Pipelines
Verbesserung und stetige Anpassungen am Monitoring inklusive Anwendungsspezifischen Metriken
Durchführung von Interviews mit DevOps Engineering Kandidaten, stellst sie ein und sorgst für ihr Onboarding und ihre Weiterentwicklung
Entwicklung einer langfristigen, skalierbaren Strategie für den Bereich DevOps, die Du mit deinem Team umsetzen kannst; inklusive einer langfristigen Strategie für den Live-Betrieb unserer Anwendungen
Konzeption und Entwicklung von KPIs sowie deren Messung
Beratung unserer Squads hinsichtlich schlanker, agiler Vorgehensweisen im ganzen SDLC
Beratung unserer Squads hinsichtlich moderner Automatisierungslösungen für interne Test-System
Enge Abstimmung mit unserer IT-Security, inklusive der Weiterentwicklung und Umsetzung von sicherheitsrelevanten Maßnahmen zur Steigerung der IT-Sicherheit

Dein Profil

Min. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich DevOps
Erste Erfahrung als technischer Leader
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in den Bereichen Containerarchitektur, Kubernetes und Orchestrierung
Starke Erfahrung mit Cloud Umgebungen
Tiefgehende Erfahrung mit CI/CD Pipelines
Linux und die Shell sind dein zweites zu Hause
Hohes technisches Verständnis von Container Technologien
Analytisches Vorgehen und ein Auge für Metriken

Nice-to-have

Erfahrung mit dem Deployment von Java-basierten Anwendungen

title: Senior Mobile Game Developer (C++) - Forge of Empires
description:
Our Forge of Empires team wants to strengthen the technical infrastructure of the game. Therefore we need a Senior Mobile Game Developer who is willing to join the technical infrastructure team of our most successful gaming project!
As a Senior Mobile Game Developer in the tech team, you will have touch-points with all the Game Developers of the project, but your focus will be on the infrastructure for our mobile Cocos2D-X game. Thus you would need to be skilled in developing in C++.
Are you an experienced Mobile Game Developer looking for a new, long-term challenge in your career? Live your passion for online games/Mobile Development and grow even further professionally as part of our driven & experienced Game Developer community!
Your mission:

Have a positive impact on the development of the Forge of Empires mobile game
Build a better technical infrastructure for our Game Developers by continuously refining and optimizing the existing development environment
Grow professionally and influence the professional growth of your colleagues by fostering a culture of knowledge sharing, best practices, and standards
Collaborate closely with Mobile-, Frontend- & Backend Developers, Game Designers, and Artists to increase the user experience for our players

Your skillset:

Team player and a good communicator with fluent English language skills
At least 4 years of professional experience working with C++, ideally using Cocos2D-X
At least 2 years of professional experience in native app development (Android, iOS)
Excellent understanding of software architecture and design
Profound knowledge of continuous integration and tools (e.g., git, Jenkins, Fastlane, Go)
Good knowledge of Rendering and Profiling

Favorable

Passion for online games (strategy/F2P) and knowledge of relevant game mechanics
Professional experience in the gaming industry, ideally working on comparable mobile games
Theoretical understanding of Software Development, ideally based on a University degree in Computer Sciences, Business Information Systems or similar studies
A proactive and motivated individual with a willingness to learn

Your power-ups:

Get competitive compensation as well as a sabbatical, mobile device, contribution to your public transport ticket, and more
De-stress your private life with flexible working hours, the in-house gym, services such as a hairdresser, massage, bike inspection, and more
Participate in tons of the company's get-togethers ranging from an in-house sofa concert to a virtual wine tasting
Make the most of our excellent training and development opportunities
Feel comfortable in an atmosphere to empower creative thinking and strong results
Work in an agile multicultural team – enabling you and your team to form and actively optimize work processes
Our company language is English, and we support all our employees and their partners with optional German lessons
Receive exceptional support with your relocation to Hamburg
Shape the success story of InnoGames with our international team of driven experts in a stable growing company and award-winning employer

Our story:
InnoGames is Germany's leading developer and publisher of mobile and online games.
The company based in Hamburg is best known for Forge of Empires, Elvenar, and Tribal Wars. InnoGames' complete portfolio encompasses seven live games and several mobile titles in production.
Born as a hobby, InnoGames today has a team of 400 employees from more than 30 nations who share the passion of creating unique games that players across the globe enjoy for years.
To further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.
Excited to start your journey with InnoGames and join our dynamic team as a Senior Mobile Game Developer?
We look forward to receiving your application as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form. Maximilian Kaeding would be happy to answer any questions you may have.
Apply and #stayhome!
Due to the coronavirus outbreak, we switched our operations company-wide to home office and turned our hiring process into a fully virtual one.
When hiring, we are also open for our new team members starting their work remotely at the time being or adjusting contract start dates accordingly.
Stay home and safe!

title: Senior Software Architect / Engineer who enjoys coding web services in c#
description:
100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please).
What We Do
The team at MapLarge builds cutting edge products for data analytics and visualization to make us safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The Maplarge API provides real time geospatial analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly visualize and publish for data discovery and model testing on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.
Who We Need
Cultural Fit - While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, there are three key traits we require of every team member that really define our team.
Fun to Work With - Life is short and work should be fun.
Extremely Smart - We work on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can both architect and code these systems at the same time while working with a highly intelligent peer group.
Passionate Engineers - We need people who really love programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in what you do.
Types of Roles & Requirements
We need talented people to help add cool new features to our platform.  Below are the general categories of tasks we are working on, but often people straddle multiple areas so take them more as the general "gist" of what you might do with us. We are looking for smart, hard working, fun people and we will invent the right role to fit them.  The key trait we are looking for is people who like to both architect/design and write the code for complex systems.
(1) Client Side - Interactive Visuals: We maintain a JavaScript API for for interactive Data Visualization using our high performance web services. We need people both to help add new dynamic animated UI components and other features to the JS API. We also need people to build data driven visuals for our demo gallery if you are artistically or data analysis inclined. Enjoy working with Knockout, Angular, D3.js, HTML5? Check our our galleries to see the kind of stuff you will be working on http://maplarge.com/demos
**(2) Full Stack Web Services - **Full stack developers who are comfortable working on both client and server side to produce high performance applications powered by scalable web services are the backbone of our team.  We run c# in both .net and mono server side and also maintain a flexible client side API with a large library of reusable components. We host and run large deployments that sometimes scale to thousands of computers for scientific/industrial/gov users and in a typical day process data over 15 billion records from 110 million streaming data sources.
(3) Algorithm / Core Database Development -  We built our own in memory database and distributed data analytics pipeline from the ground up with funding from DARPA, and we have a team of really talented researchers working on Pattern analysis, Streaming analytics, Spatial queries and Network graph functions that power our visual engines. We are always looking for practical people who love writing highly optimized code that straddles the line between research and software development. We don't usually publish scientific papers, but we are right out on the edge pulling algorithms out of the latest research papers finding really fast "good enough" approaches that let us tease interesting patterns out of data without getting lost in "science experiment land"
Requirements:

US Person based anywhere in the US (100% remote allowed but no off shore)
5 Years work experience as a programmer
Highly Comfortable with C# and Visual Studio
Experienced with Web Development & JavaScript

MapLarge is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MapLarge is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Full Stack .Net Web Application Developer
description:
What We Do
The team at MapLarge builds cutting edge products for data analytics and visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient for our millions of users and thousands of customers.  The Maplarge API provides real time geospatial analytics for billions of location events every day. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly visualize and publish for data discovery and predictive model testing on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.
Who We Need
Cultural Fit - While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, there are three key traits we require of every team member that really define our team.
Fun to Work With - Life is short and work should be fun.
Extremely Smart - We work on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can both architect and code these systems at the same time while working with a highly intelligent peer group.
Passionate Engineers - We need people who really love programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in what you do.
About the Role
This role is for full stack .Net web developers who enjoy working with WebService API's in C# on the server side and creating sophisticated single page applications in TypeScript and JavaScript on the client side. In this role you will be helping to design and build the server and client side API's for MapLarge components that we combine into new interactive dashboards.    This job is for advanced programmers only and you do not have to have any design, css or other artistic skills.   Please be ready to tell us about any experience you have working with complex single page applications, designing C# web service API's and building reusable components with JavaScript or TypeScript.
Requirements:

US Person based anywhere in the US (100% remote allowed but no off shore)
5 Years work experience as a programmer
Highly Comfortable with Typescript, C# and Visual Studio
Very Experienced with Web Development & JavaScript

MapLarge is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MapLarge is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
About MapLarge
MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make us safer, more productive, and more efficient.   Our platform powers high traffic website visualizations, data discovery, and business intelligence applications. These visualizations can be synchronized in a dashboard to quickly discover insights by simultaneously viewing a segment of the data in multiple forms including maps.

title: Lead Application Developer / Technical Project Manager
description:
100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please).
Who We Need: We are looking for experienced senior software developers to act as lead application developers helping to design and build applications for customers on top of the MapLarge product suite.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer. We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.
Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.
Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:
Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.
Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.
Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.
MapLarge is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MapLarge is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
About MapLarge:
Real World Impact: At MapLarge we’re passionate about building software that solves some of the world’s hardest and most interesting problems across dozens of industries. We partner with the largest and most sophisticated institutions in the world to improve the lives of their users and customers with clever use of data and technology. Our products have been used to keep the world safe, improve global healthcare outcomes, deliver billions of packages on time, keep every plane in the sky safe and fuel efficient, improve navigation and safety for every boat in the ocean in real-time and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
High Value Innovative Enterprise Products & Solutions: MapLarge products provide an enterprise focused platform for geospatial analytics and visualization. Our solution teams develop integrated solutions on top of our products across multiple different industry verticals and use cases - all focused on large enterprise and government agencies. If you enjoy working with sophisticated teammates, to build cutting edge solutions for high value customers that appreciate innovative solutions, then MapLarge is the place for you.

title: YouVersion Mobile Android
description:
YouVersion Mobile Engineer - Android
EDMOND, OK /YOUVERSION – YOUVERSION PRODUCT & ENGINEERING /FULL-TIME
The YouVersion Mobile Engineer will help people around the world engage with God’s Word by developing, refining, and growing the YouVersion Bible App mobile experience on Android devices.
God has placed you on the earth for a reason, at this crucial moment in time. He’s given you a purpose. With the smartest tech at our fingertips and more distractions vying for our attention than ever before, the need for the Bible has never been greater. If you’re looking for a place you can combine the skills God has given you with your passion to see people engage with His Word in new ways—no matter where they are or what languages they speak—the YouVersion Team is the place to start. Come change the world with us!
We’re looking for a unique individual with a passion for Android application development to serve as a Mobile App Engineer. With more than a quarter of a billion installs of the Bible App and 40 million installs of the Bible App for Kids, the YouVersion team continues to grow and evolve in an effort to appropriately steward the opportunities brought our way. Are you excited about building awesome mobile apps for a variety of tablets and smart phone devices and interested in exploring the unique challenges of large-scale mobile apps? Then keep reading!
You'll be:
-Contributing to all aspects of development on our mobile engineering team helping to drive
enhancements to our Android application
-Engaging as an active member within our agile development process
-Collaborating with our various platform teams to ensure features and software design patterns are
consistent
-Testing, debugging, and maintaining software throughout the product lifecycle
You'll fit right in if you are:
-Passionate about the mission of YouVersion: Helping people engage with the Bible
-Great at solving large, complicated, and difficult technology problems
-Looking to dedicate your life to something that makes a difference on a global scale
-A team player who is willing to do whatever it takes to make the team successful
-Living in or willing to relocate to the Oklahoma City metro area
You'll work well if you:
-Are experienced with Android technologies (Java, Android SDK, etc.)
-Have strong time management and organizational skills to drive projects to completion
-Published one or more applications in the Android Market
-Know Git
You'll love us if:
Brewing your morning cup requires at least seven different apparatuses, none of which are a coffeemaker
Your root@localhost password is the chemical formula for caffeine
You can translate English into Binary
This role is located at Life.Church Central Offices in Edmond, OK.
how_to_apply: Apply at Life.Church/Careers or using the link in logo.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
About us
Our mission is to redefine the multi-trillion dollar logistics industry - transforming it to address the pressing needs of the 21st century. Supply chain accounts for ~10% of Global GDP and is one of the largest barriers to addressing major global challenges like sustainability, air pollution and food waste. By changing how organizations work together across the global supply chain, we will play a critical role in tackling these challenges head on and unblocking human advancement. We are a team of serial entrepreneurs with extensive backgrounds building world class product, engineering, operations, sales & marketing teams. We know what it takes to go from zero-to-one AND what it takes to achieve scale and transform markets.
About the role
We are looking for a product-minded software engineer who is comfortable with both front and back-end software development to join our founding engineering team. You will be responsible for development and architecture of the application while ensuring stability, security and responsiveness. You will be one of the early technical hires and will help define engineering architecture, process and culture for years to come.
Responsibilities:

Collaborate with product management, operations and sales to build a product that our customers genuinely love.
Communicate effectively within the organization with people sitting next to you and those multiple time zones away. We believe in breaking down silos with strong communication.
Own features from start to finish: test, development, deployment, and infrastructure.
Never stop learning. You’ll be responsible for mentoring and learning through code review process, tech talks, and many ad hoc technical conversations.
Use your judgment to decide what areas of codebase to invest in, when to incur technical debt, when to move fast, and when to slow down.
Wear many hats: help with scaling our engineering team, define engineering processes, understand the logistics business, and collaborate with other functions within ISO.

We get excited about candidates who have:

Highly experienced with back-end programming languages like Ruby, Python, Java, or JavaScript and frameworks such as Ruby on Rails, Django, or Express.js
Enjoy building amazing customer experience using React, Redux or TypeScript
Experience using cloud infrastructure providers such as AWS, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud
Real-world experience with PostgreSQL
Advanced knowledge of Git and Github
Experience working in an agile and fast-paced working environment

Nice to Have:

Experience in the early-mid stages of a fast-growing company
You are a self-starter: clubs, volunteer work, passion projects - we want to hear about them!

title: Infrastructure Engineer for Social Livestreaming App
description:
WHO WE ARE
EME Hive is a community-based, social live streaming app for finding like-minded friends and partners. Through the power of live streaming technology, users are able to form real-time connections with members of their own communities. By offering a subscription dating service as well as a live streaming platform, EME makes it easy for users to flirt, chat, and date in real-time -- all within the same app!
We are a team of innovative, and friendly individuals who are redefining the rules of connection. We believe that our dedication to live-streaming and online dating technologies will bring highly efficient and safer connections to many minority communities all over the world. We are currently looking for a strong Infrastructure Engineer to join our growing team and share in our enthusiasm for taking on today’s toughest challenges in live-streaming.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
-Design, build, and maintain distributed content and service systems
-Research and develop content and media delivery technology, such as WebRTC, HTTP Multicast, Anycast, etc.
-Develop network and service metrics-gathering solutions that inform automation and perform system monitoring/alerting to secure our services, validate network security configurations, and protect against network disruption.
-System development, configuration and deployment of infrastructure atop cloud VPS or 3rd party platform, namely:
 -Proxy Servers such as haproxy, nginx, ProxySQL

 -Database/Web servers such as Redis, Redis Cluster, MySQL, MySQL cluster, Rails, Go, Vapor

 -Services such as PubSub messaging, video recording, video transcoding, managed + distributed 
  cloud store, CDN

 -Supporting servers and services such as orchestrator, CircleCI, GCP, AWS, GitHub, Ansible

-Manage and work with 3rd party infrastructure-as-a-service and video software vendors.
-Assist with writing formal requirements and specifications documents; building and documenting solutions.
-Maintain communication of project statuses and drive continued improvement in quality and availability of each the systems and product.
-Contribute to our culture of shipping greatness, quality and customer focused approach.
WHAT YOU MUST HAVE
-BS or MS degree in Computer Science.
-2+ years of engineering experience building scalable distributed systems
-Deep technical background in or strong familiarity with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Ruby, C++, MySQL,, HTML, CSS, Cloud VPS, Linux, Redis.
-Ability to learn and understand new technologies/systems quickly.
-Solid software development fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, problem solving, and system architecture).
-Experience integrating low-level software for purpose-built solutions.
-Working knowledge of content delivery networks and data center infrastructure.
-In depth knowledge of video compression, encoding, decoding, streaming, and analytics.
-Experience in developing/deploying streaming infrastructure on cloud services.
-Previous experience with video processing services or infrastructure such as AWS Elemental MediaConvert/MediaLive, MediaConnect, or ffmpeg in-a-box
-Experience working closely across a variety of teams including product management, designers, and backend engineers.
-Creative problem-solving skills while working in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
how_to_apply: Email your resume and cover letter to recruiting@emehive.co (not .com!).  Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: R&D Programmer (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind Covestro. Wir sind neugierig. Wir sind mutig. Wir sind vielfältig. Wir haben chemische Materiallösungen mit bahnbrechenden Produkten verfeinert. Lassen Sie uns gemeinsam Grenzen überschreiten. Schließen Sie sich uns und unseren 17.200 Kollegen an und zusammen werden wir die Welt lebenswerter machen.
R&D Programmer (m/w/d)
IHRE AUFGABEN UND VERANTWORTLICHKEITEN
Das Team Digital R&D (DRD) ist verantwortlich für innovative computerunterstützte Lösungen für die chemische Produkt- und Anwendungsentwicklung bei Covestro. DRD integriert Expertise einerseits für Materialsimulationen und Computational Chemistry, andererseits Kompetenzen für Laborautomatisierung, R&D Data Science und High Performance Computing (HPC).

In Ihrer neuen Position sind Sie verantwortlich für das Programmieren und Scripten von Softwarekomponenten und -Workflows im Bereich Scientific Computing als Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams aus Simulationswissenschaftlern (m/w(d) und Data Scientists / Data Engineers (m/w/d) etc.
Sie unterstützen die Wissenschaftler, Ingenieure und Techniker (m/w/d) der Abteilung bei der effizienten Umsetzung und Optimierung von Inhouse-Lösungen und Expertentools
Der Aufbau und die Pflege von Programm- und Daten-Workflows mit modernen Methoden fällt ebenfalls in Ihren Aufgabenbereich
Sie übernehmen auch die Vorbereitung von Software Deployments und die Schnittstellenassistenz zum HPC-Administrations-Team

WAS SIE MITBRINGEN

Sie verfügen über eine Hochschulstudium oder abgeschlossene Ausbildung in den Bereichen Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaften, Technologie (MINT) oder vergleichbar
Ihr Profil zeigt sehr gute Kenntnisse in Programmier- und Skriptsprachen wie C/C++, Python, VBA (optional) und JavaScript (optional)
Sie haben zudem Kenntnisse von relationalen Datenbanken (SQL) sowie Interesse an dokumentenorientierten Datenbanken (NoSQL) und verteilten Dateisystemen (DFS)
Eine proaktive Arbeitseinstellung, Eigeninitiative und der Wunsch, das Fachwissen zu erhalten und neue Fähigkeiten und Kenntnisse für die erforderlichen Bereiche zu erwerben, sind für Sie selbstverständlich
Fließende Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift, runden Ihr Profil ab

IHRE BEWERBUNG
Sind Sie neugierig, mutig und vielfältig? Dann bieten wir Ihnen spannende Karrieremöglichkeiten. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung über den Bewerben-Button mit Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Ihren relevanten Zeugnissen. Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams – Bewerben Sie sich jetzt!
Für einen ersten telefonischen Kontakt steht Ihnen Frau Isabell Ramrath, Telefon 02146009 8246, gerne zur Verfügung.
Land
Deutschland
Standort
Leverkusen
Referenzcode
JR-2020-01732
recruiting@covestro.com
Covestro begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, Nationalität, Religion, Weltanschauung, Geschlecht, Alter, Behinderung, Aussehen und/oder sexueller Identität. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.
Wir möchten, dass Sie sich bei Covestro wie zu Hause fühlen. Dass Sie das Gefühl haben, fair und transparent behandelt zu werden. Das bedeutet finanzielle Sicherheit, eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance und ansprechende Sozialleistungen. Konkret heißt es für uns: flexible Arbeitszeiten, die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, eine aktive Gesundheitsförderung und die Möglichkeit einen Teil Ihres Gehalts ins
Langzeitkonto oder für die Altersvorsorge umzuwandeln. Und das ist nicht alles.
Klingt spannend? Weitere Informationen zum Thema Karriere und zu unseren Benefits finden Sie unter: www.career.covestro.de
Klicken Sie hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!
how_to_apply: Klicken Sie hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
PGGM heeft voor haar locatie in Zeist een vacature voor een
Lead Software Engineer
32-36 uur - Zeist
Software ontwikkelen waardoor continuïteit en kwaliteit van onze applicaties, waarin we de pensioenen administreren, nog beter wordt. Zo ga jij impact maken bij PGGM!
Jouw rol als Lead Software Engineer
Vanuit een klein team werken jij en je collega developers aan back-end oplossingen. Het team beheert en ontwikkelt softwaresystemen waarmee we met pensioendeelnemers communiceren, via pensioenoverzichten (UPO’s) en via het Pensioenregister (www.mijnpensioenoverzicht.nl). Jouw werk zal uit een breed scala aan activiteiten bestaan, waaronder het analyseren, ontwikkelen, testen en beheren van IT-oplossingen. Wat je doet, hangt af van wat er nodig is voor het team en vraagt een hoge mate van flexibiliteit. Jouw topprioriteit is om te leveren wat je belooft: toekomstbestendige IT-oplossingen.
Omdat de wereld snel verandert, wordt er binnen het team constant gewerkt aan persoonlijke en vaktechnische ontwikkeling. Jij als Lead Developer hebt daar een belangrijke en impactvolle rol in. Jij gaat collega's binnen het team coachen en begeleiden, zodat zij kunnen groeien in hun rol en op een hoger niveau kunnen meedraaien. Samen met je team bepaal je of het aanwezige kennis- en vaardigheidsniveau binnen het team voldoende is en blijft. Ook krijg jij binnen het team de trekkersrol als het aankomt op het oppakken van initiatieven en op het gebied van innovatie. Een mooie veelzijdige rol waarin zowel jouw technische kennis en skills aan bod komen, maar waarbij je ook aan de slag gaat met het overbrengen van deze vaardigheden en coachen op social skills.
Wil je weten hoe het is om bij PGGM binnen software development te werken? Bekijk dan deze video, waarin onze collega's je vertellen over hun ervaringen - Software Development.
Eric Jan Aling, Lead Software Engineer: “Samen met je DevOps team kwalitatief hoge software ontwikkelen die bijdraagt aan een betrouwbare dienstverlening voor de pensioengerechtigden. Een mooie inhoudelijke en impactvolle uitdaging, waar ieder teamlid aan bijdraagt.”
Jouw afdeling binnen PGGM
PGGM heeft als pensioenuitvoeringsorganisatie de missie om mensen te helpen bij het realiseren van een waardevolle toekomst. Maatschappelijk betrokken en duurzaam handelen zijn daarbij onze uitgangspunten. Vanuit Zeist werken zo’n 1.500 medewerkers aan de oude dag van miljoenen Nederlanders.
Samen met 5 collega’s werk je in scrumteam Pensioencommunicatie, dat jaarlijks ruim 3 miljoen pensioenoverzichten voor deelnemers maakt, en 1,5 miljoen raadplegingen van www.mijnpensioenoverzicht.nl ondersteunt. Je komt dus te werken in een multidisciplinair team bestaand uit een scrummaster, developers en een tester.
Het pensioencommunicatieteam is een zelfsturend team, waarbinnen er kritisch naar elkaar gekeken wordt en waar open en eerlijk met elkaar gecommuniceerd wordt. Het verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel is groot en jouw collega’s inspireren en motiveren elkaar om tot een hoger niveau te komen. Binnen dit professionele maar zeker ook gezellige team, krijg jij volop kansen om jouw vakmanschap te tonen en met de nieuwste tooling en technieken te werken.
Wil je een breder beeld zien van Software Development binnen PGGM? Klik door naar deze video
Jouw achtergrond als Lead Software Engineer
Je bent analytisch sterk en met jouw oplossingsgerichte instelling ga jij een uitdaging niet snel uit de weg. Dat je vooral ook een echte teamspeler moet zijn zal je inmiddels wel duidelijk zijn. Vanwege de intensieve samenwerking moeten teamleden elkaar vertrouwen en op elkaar kunnen bouwen. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen en zien dit ook graag bij jou terug. En jouw topprioriteit, het werken aan toekomstbestendige IT-oplossingen? Dit heb jij altijd scherp op je netvlies.
Verder breng je mee:

hbo werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur een opleiding in een IT of technische richting.
minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring , bijvoorbeeld als backend engineer, developer of software ontwikkelaar.
kennis van en ruime ervaring met .Net, ASP.Net Core, SQL en SSIS, design patterns zoals dependency injection, onion architecture, DDD, Azure, MS build / pipelines.
ook ben je bekend met GIT en Testautomatisering.
ervaring met Agile werken.
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.

Dutch speaking candidates only!
Wat wij bieden:
PGGM staat bekend om goed werkgeverschap. We belonen onze medewerkers voor hun inzet en hechten veel waarde aan een goede balans tussen werk en privé. Uiteraard zien we graag dat jij je verder ontwikkelt en daarom ondersteunen we je hierin.
Jij mag rekenen op:

een functie met gegarandeerde maatschappelijke impact.
een brutomaandsalaris tussen € 3.000 en € 5.300, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.
een vaste aanstelling bij indiensttreding - contract voor onbepaalde tijd.
een 32 tot 36-urige werkweek met de mogelijkheid om je uren flexibel in te delen.
ruime mogelijkheden om vanuit huis te werken, nu werken wij volledig thuis en naar verwachting zullen wij in de toekomst ook deels vanuit huis blijven werken.
ruim 26 vakantiedagen.
een goede pensioenregeling als deelnemer van pensioenfonds PFZW. (71,5% betaald door PGGM, 28,5% door werknemer)
een eindejaarsuitkering van 7,5%.
een ruim opleidingsbudget voor interne en externe trainingen of opleidingen.
een collectieve ziektekostenverzekering bij CZ. Je krijgt korting op de basisverzekering en aanvullende pakketten van CZ.

Meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden en salarisschalen lees je in onze CAO, die je vindt onder 'Arbeidsvoorwaarden' op pggm.nl/werken-bij.
how_to_apply:
Wil jij als Lead Software Engineer de verantwoordelijkheid dragen voor een goed pensioen van 4,4 miljoen pensioendeelnemers? Solliciteer dan op deze vacature en kies voor een baan met impact.
Wij ontvangen je sollicitatie graag via onze sollicitatiepagina.
Informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure vind je terug op onze website.
PGGM en Corona
Door de Corona situatie, werken de meeste PGGM’ers momenteel vanuit huis. Als we met je kennis willen maken, betekent dit dat de interviews grotendeels via videocalls plaatsvinden. Een afrondend gesprek doen we op kantoor. Nemen we je aan? Dan zal het grootste deel van jouw inwerktraject op afstand gebeuren. Hierbij maken we gebruik van Microsoft Teams. Het is beperkt mogelijk om collega’s op kantoor te ontmoeten.
Aan intermediairs
We weten dat er veel partijen zijn die graag met ons mee willen zoeken of hun diensten willen aanbieden voor deze vacature, maar bij PGGM werven we nieuwe collega’s zelf. Acquisitie naar een werving & selectie-opdracht of onaangekondigde aanbiedingen van CV's stellen we dan ook niet op prijs en nemen wij niet in behandeling. Mochten we er niet uitkomen, dan bellen we jou.

title: Fullstack Entwickler (Kotlin, React)
description:
Wir sind ein Berliner Internet of Things (IoT) Software Unternehmen. Unsere IoT Plattform ermöglicht es, einfach und schnell industrielle IoT Anwendungen umzusetzen. Bereits seit 2006 bieten wir Software „Made in Germany” für nationale und internationale Kunden an. Sowohl in Europa, Amerika als auch in China, sind unsere IoT-Lösungen im Einsatz. Als Spezialisten für Digitalisierung und IoT wird unsere TÜV-geprüfte IoT-Plattform bereits in verschiedensten Branchen eingesetzt. Diverse Forschungsprojekte und langjährige OEM-Partnerschaften in der Industrie unterstreichen unsere Kompetenz und Expertise zur Lösung anspruchsvollster IoT-Projekte. Mit unserer Open Source Edge Software und der brandneuen IoT Plattform gehen wir noch einen Schritt weiter und werden das Internet der Dinge für alle ermöglichen.
Weitere Informationen über uns unter www.azeti.net.
Deine Aufgaben
Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf uns eine moderne Anwendung from scratch zu implementieren. Dabei kannst Du dich auf einen top Technologie Stack (Kotlin, React, Kafka) freuen. Als Fullstack Entwickler wirst Du direkt involviert beim Design und der Implementierung und bist integraler Bestandteil des Teams.
Dein Profil

Erfahrung in der Entwicklung in agilen Umgebungen (Scrum, Kanban)
Hohes Maß an Eigenorganisation und aktive Kommunikation
Umfangreiche Erfahrung mit Kotlin und Spring

Mindestens 1 Jahr Erfahrung Umgang mit Functional Components ReactJS und TypeScript

Erfahrung in der Entwicklung Event getriebener Applikationen
Erfahrung mit Kafka ist ein Plus

Fundierte Erfahrung mit Git sowie CI/CD
PWA Erfahrung ist ein plus
Du sprichst fließend Englisch
Deutsch Sprachkenntnisse sind ein Plus aber kein Muss

Warum wir?
Diese seltsamen Zeiten verlangen uns allen viel ab. Wir bieten unserem Team ein sicheres und langfristiges Arbeitsumfeld und sind auf der Suche nach neuen Teammitgliedern, die unser Team für die nächsten Jahre ergänzen. Neben einem sicheren Geschäftsmodell, sind wir als Tochterunternehmen der Aurubis AG ein sicherer Arbeitgeber für Deine berufliche Zukunft.

Stabiles und sicheres Arbeitsumfeld
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Rücksicht auf deine Familienbedürfnisse (Kita, Home Schooling etc.)
Home Office
Freie Wahl des Arbeitsgerätes (Linux, Mac, Windows) und Ausrüstung für Dein Home Office
Überdurchschnittliches Gehalt und großartige Karriereentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Buntes, internationales Team, flache Hierarchien und agiles Arbeiten
Jeder trägt bei uns Verantwortung und gestaltet Produkte aktiv mit
Top-notch Technologie Stack mit spannenden Entwicklungen und kontinuerlicher Lernkurve

Urban Sports Club Mitgliedschaft, vollständig von uns bezahlt
Bike Leasing bei business-bike oder jobrad


Corporate Benefits Programm mit attraktiven Rabatten
Kontinuierliche Weiterbildung, 100 EUR Udemy Kursbudget pro Monat

company: Rhenus Freight Network GmbH & Co. KG
title: Senior Entwickler (w/m/d) Self-Contained-Systems
description:
Gibt es eine Logistik für Karrieren? Bei uns schon. Als weltweit operierender Logistikdienstleister mit 33.000 Mitarbeitern in über 50 Ländern managen wir komplexe Supply Chains und bieten unseren Kunden innovative Mehrwertdienste. Als interner Software-Dienstleister entwickelt Rhenus Freight Network standardisierte Softwarelösungen zur Steuerung, Optimierung und Kontrolle von Transportprozessen zu Land, zu Wasser und in der Luft. Ziel dabei: Agile Lösungen zu finden und stetig an sich ändernde Bedarfe anzupassen.
Senior Entwickler (w/m/d) Self-Contained-Systems
Als Experte auf deinem Gebiet, hast du Lust darauf Verantwortung zu übernehmen und deinen Kollegen bei der Entwicklung unserer Profukte helfend zur Seite zu stehen. Dir bringt es Spaß, Neuheiten zu entdecken, um daraus einen Mehrwert für das Unternehmen zu ziehen und in Projekte umzuwandeln. Darüber hinaus sind dir Technologien wie Spring Boot oder Git nicht fremd.
Das erwartet Dich bei uns

Du konzipierst und entwickelst Self-Contained-Systems, für mehrere webbasierte Angebots- und Tarifsysteme der Rhenus.
Dein Aufgabenfeld deckt alle Bereiche des Entwicklungsprozesses ab, sowohl Backend als auch Frontend und reicht von der Spezifikation, bis zum Test der fertigen Systeme.
Dabei arbeitest du mit aktuellen Technologien wie Spring Boot, Vue.js, Docker und Git.
In deiner Rolle als Senior Entwickler leitest du deine Kollegen an und stehst ihnen, auch als Ansprechpartner bei Fragen zur Technik, Architektur und den Technologien, zur Seite.
Darüber hinaus unterstützt du uns bei der Steuerung von externen Dienstleistern.

Das bringst Du mit

Neben einem Studium der Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Ausbildung, kannst du uns mit deinen Erfahrungen im Backend-Entwicklungsbereich Java begeistern.
Deine Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Spring und Datenbanktechnologien wie SQL, MongoDB oder Elasticsearch, sind die eines Senior Entwicklers.
In der Frontend-Entwicklung hast du Erfahrung mit JavaScript (bzw. Node.js, TypeScript) und aktuellen Frameworks wie Vue.js, Angular oder React.
Dein Qualitätsanspruch, hochwertige Software zu entwickeln, erreichst du durch Clean Codes, Softwaretests und durchdachte Architekturen.
Aktuelle Trends in der Softwareentwicklung behältst du gerne im Blick und hast den Wunsch, diese sinnvoll in Projekte umzusetzen.

Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen

Agile Arbeitswelt
Ergonomische Arbeitsplätze
Firmenfahrrad
Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Kostenlose Getränke
Mobiles Arbeiten

Dein Kontakt:
Rhenus Freight Network GmbH
Julia Schuermann
+492301292540

title: Backend Developer (m/w/d)
description:
OUR MISSION
limango is the Online Shop for families – We wow our customers every day with a fantastic range of brands at very attractive prices. Based in Munich, our 300 employees share a passion for families. We do everything we can to understand their needs and fulfil their wishes. limango has everything families need: Fashion for Babies, Kids, Women and Men as well as Homeware, Toys, Cosmetics and Family holidays. At limango you’ll find both classic brands and upcoming brands from across Europe. Founded in 2007 and a member of the Otto Group since 2009 limango now has over 14 million members across Germany, Austria, France, the Netherlands and Poland and sells over 40 000 products daily to German customers alone. We want to continue to grow and win the trust of all mums in Europe. To help us achieve this, we’re looking for motivated, talented individuals to work with us and be a part of something big.
YOUR JOB

In the limango IT you get the chance to contribute your own ideas and know-how to the development of services all around the different processes of our ecommerce business
Together with our experienced and international development teams you will improve and expand our backend systems.
You will become part of our well-rehearsed agile teams of versatile and experienced developers and a dedicated product owner

YOUR PROFILE

A degree with a focus on IT or a comparable training
You have sound professional experience in the development of scalable eCommerce applications in common PHP frameworks such as Symfony3+ as well as knowledge of OOP and design patterns
You bring practical experience with RESTful APIs and service-oriented architecture
You have profound experience in relational databases (MySQL/MariaDB)
DevOps and GoLang experience are desirable
A well-functioning tool is not enough for you - you enjoy optimizing complex IT processes!

OUR OFFER

Challenging tasks, independent work and a great deal of creative freedom in a working environment that burns for results and is happy to be measured against them
An open, team-oriented working atmosphere
A steep learning curve in a dynamic company with international orientation
A great office in Munich's Tech-Spot with probably the coolest roof terrace in the city
Corporate events, fresh fruit and soft drinks

Interested? We look forward to receiving your complete application including a letter of motivation, salary requirements and your earliest possible starting date.

ABOUT US
wundertax simplifies the filing of taxes for everyone. With our state-of-the-art online tool, we help our customers to do their taxes fast, simple and without the need for an expensive tax advisor. As a result, we already generated more than 200 million euros in tax refunds for our customers.
Next to our general employee tool, wundertax operates several target specific online portals such as for students, police officers, soldiers or trainees to respond to the different needs of our users. We also operate the leading English-language portal for expats.
